pageContext.claim: “Doing great with China and other Trade Deals. The only problem we have is Jay Powell and the Fed. He’s like a golfer who can't putt, has no touch. Big U.S. growth if he does the right thing, BIG CUT - but don't count on him! So far he has called it wrong, and only let us down.”
pageContext.analysis: The Federal Reserve, as a central bank in charge of monetary policy, is politically independent. Its job is not to help the president's short-term political goals but to ensure the long-term stability of the U.S. economy.
